data.title: Applesauce
data.description: Apple sauce or applesauce is a sauce made of apples. It can be made with flat top or unpeeled apples and a variety of spices (commonly cinnamon and allspice).

data.title: Garum
data.description: Garum was a fermented fish sauce used as a condiment[1] in the cuisines of ancient Greece, Rome, and later Byzantium.

data.title: Chutney
data.description: Chutney is a sauce or a dry base for a sauce in the cuisines of the Indian subcontinent that can include such forms as tomato relish, a ground peanut garnish or a yogurt, cucumber and mint dip.

data.title: Mayonnaise
data.description: Mayonnaise, often abbreviated as mayo, is a thick, creamy dressing often used as a condiment.

data.title: Béchamel
data.description: Béchamel sauce, also known as white sauce, is made from a white roux (butter and flour) and milk.

data.title: Worcestershire Sauce
data.description: Worcestershire sauce, frequently shortened to Worcester sauce, is a fermented liquid condiment of complex mixture

data.title: Soy Sauce
data.description: Soy sauce is a liquid condiment of Chinese origin, made from a fermented paste of soybeans, roasted grain, brine, and Aspergillus oryzae or Aspergillus sojae molds.

data.title: Gravy
data.description: Gravy is a sauce often made from the juices of meats that run naturally during cooking and tightened with wheat flour or cornstarch for added texture.

data.title: Bolognese
data.description: Bolognese sauce is a meat-based sauce originating from Bologna.

data.title: Pesto
data.description: Pesto is a sauce originating in Genoa, the capital city of Liguria, Italy.

data.title: Zhug
data.description: Zhug is a Middle Eastern hot sauce originating in Yemeni cuisine.

data.title: Sambal
data.description: Sambal is a hot sauce or paste typically made from a mixture of a variety of chili peppers with secondary ingredients such as shrimp paste, fish sauce, garlic, ginger, shallot, scallion, palm sugar, lime juice, and rice vinegar or other vinegars.

data.title: Sriracha
data.description: Sriracha is a type of hot sauce or chili sauce made from a paste of chili peppers, distilled vinegar, garlic, sugar, and salt.

data.title: Ajilimójili
data.description: Ajilimójili is a hot sauce or hot and sweet sauce from Puerto Rico, traditionally served over grilled seafood, vegetables, boiled tuber vegetables and especially grilled meats.

data.title: Caruso Sauce
data.description: Caruso Sauce or Salsa Caruso is a warm sauce made of cream, ham, cheese, nuts and mushrooms.

data.title: Khrenovina
data.description: Khrenovina sauce is a spicy horseradish sauce served with a main course, which is very popular in Siberia.

data.title: Cebolada
data.description: Cebolada is a Portuguese onion stew, onion sauce or paste that is prepared with onion as a primary ingredient.

data.title: Aioli
data.description: Aioli is a Mediterranean sauce made of garlic and olive oil; some regions use other emulsifiers such as egg.

data.title: Mujdei
data.description: Mujdei is a spicy Romanian sauce.

data.title: Latík
data.description: Latík refers to two different coconut-based ingredients in Philippine cuisine.

data.title: Mahyawa
data.description: Mahyawa or mehyawa is an Iranian cuisine tangy sauce made out of fermented fish.

data.title: Tzatziki
data.description: Tzatziki is made of salted strained yogurt (usually from sheep or goat milk) or diluted yogurt mixed with cucumbers, garlic, salt, olive oil, sometimes with vinegar or lemon juice, and some herbs like dill, mint, parsley, thyme etc.

data.title: Duckefett
data.description: Duckefett is a simple sauce and a regional specialty in northern Hesse, Germany, particularly in Kassel.

data.title: Chimichurri
data.description: Chimichurri or chimmichurri is an uncooked sauce used for grilled meat

data.title: Allemande Sauce
data.description: Allemande sauce is a sauce in French cuisine that is based on a light-colored velouté sauce (typically veal; chicken and shellfish veloutés can also be used), but thickened with egg yolks and heavy cream, and seasoned with lemon juice.

data.title: Tucupi
data.description: Tucupi is a yellow sauce extracted from wild manioc root in Brazil's Amazon jungle.

data.title: Llajua
data.description: Llajua or llajwa is a hot sauce prepared from locotos (Bolivian hot chili peppers) and tomatoes; sometimes onions are added to the mix.
